body_html:
Thanks for the PR @littlekfc. I think the existing formulation is correct. See http://ufldl.stanford.edu/wiki/index.php/Softmax_Regression#Cost_Function for some more details.

In this case, y_ is a matrix of [batch_size, 10] where each row is a one-hot vector indicating the class labels 0-9. Each one-hot vector is the indicator variable vector for the sample.

So when computing the log-likelihood, we apply the softmax function on the logits, and then take a log of the output of the softmax, and then multiply that (batch-wise) with the one-hot vector indicating the label.

As far as I can tell, this equation is correct, though I admit it can be a bit confusing. Definitely let me know if we're wrong after looking into this more!
